title: BBC Local Live: Herefordshire & Worcestershire on Friday 26 May 2017 - BBC News
summary: vigils in kidderminster and redditch for victims of manchester attack .
van driver jailed for killing malvern teenager .
hundreds of council staff could be underpaid by new it system , union says .

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: we 'll be back with our usual mix of news , sport , travel and weather from 08:00 on tuesday .
enjoy the bank holiday .

documents.title: ice lollies for giraffes
text: safari park staff have been feeding ice lollies to giraffes as temperatures soar across the uk .
food is put inside the blocks of ice at west midlands safari park , at bewdley in worcestershire .

documents.title: racing set for monday comeback at controversial track
text: motor racing at grimley raceway will get under way on monday for the first time in about eight months .
complaints from some local residents about the noise meant that racing at the track was suspended following a court injunction .
but malvern hills district council agreed earlier this month that racing can now resume , after a hearing to discuss its future was postponed .
author: Phil Maiden
Reporter, BBC Hereford & Worcester

documents.title: reminder that armed officers may be on the streets
text: the police are reminding us that with the heightened state of security at the moment , there may be armed officers out on the streets this bank holiday weekend .
the force says it always has armed officers based around the west mercia area , ready to react where needed , but since the terror attack in manchester it deployed additional firearms teams .
there will also be more regular police out on the streets .

documents.title: rugby : worcester warriors hooker prepares for england start
text: the worcester warriors ' young hooker jack singleton is preparing for his first start for england this weekend .
he 's among eight uncapped players in the side to face the barbarians at twickenham on sunday .
he wo n't , however , win an england cap for the game as it has been designated a `` non-cap '' fixture .
author: BBC Hereford and Worcester

documents.title: eastham bridge : latest photo
text: the bridge is open , but work to incorporate bricks from the original 18th century structure , which collapsed last year , continues .
latest photo of the new # eastham bridge showing reuse of original bricks - scaffold removed , site tidy up underway @ twitterid

documents.title: football : bromsgrove excited about worcester city fixtures
text: bromsgrove sporting are relishing the prospect of facing worcester city in the midland football league premier division next season .
city , who share the victoria ground with sporting , have been forced to step down two divisions for financial reasons .
bromsgrove 's manager paul smith described the matches as `` two huge local derbies '' and said they would be `` mouthwatering clash home and away for the fans to get involved in '' .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: trade union criticises payroll system
text: some of the lowest paid council staff have been particularly badly affected by failures in a new payroll system , trade union unison says .
last month 16,000 workers in worcestershire were moved on to a new system , but about 150 of them were underpaid by as much as £ 500 .

`` this is tending to affect the lower paid members of the council workforce , so home care assistants teaching assistants are another example , '' jim price , unison branch secretary in worcestershire , said .
`` it 's people without large regular salaries they rely on the sessional work that they do and they 're just not getting pad for that . ''
worcestershire county council says it has a large support team in place to provide technical support and advice .
the firm behind the new system has apologised .

documents.title: cricket : worcestershire batting after bowling out northants
text: play has resumed after tea at the county ground and worcestershire are batting in their county championship match .
norhamptonshire were all out for 238 in their first innings after adding 77 for the final two wickets and in reply worcestershire are 20 without loss .
jack shantry and captain joe leach helped themselves to three wickets each in northants first innings .

documents.title: bank holiday getaways : busiest roads for four years
text: highways england have suspended 150 miles of roadworks across the west midlands in anticipation of today 's bank holiday getaway .
the rac are warning drivers to expect the busiest spring bank holiday weekend for traffic in four years .
it estimates that 16.5m leisure journeys will be taken between today and monday because of soaring temperatures .

documents.title: netball : last home game of the season for severn stars
text: worcester 's professional netball team is based at the university arena .
its game day and its our last home game of the season .
get to the university of worcester arena tonight to support your stars !
# timetoshine

documents.title: slideshow : sunshine on wylde moor
text: these great photos of wylde moor near feckenham in worcestershire basking in the may sunshine were taken by one of our regular contributors , paul wilde .
i 'd love to feature your photos , especially as the weather is so good - you can email , tweet us on @ twitterid or message via facebook .
author: Jerry Chester
BBC News Online

documents.title: tributes to former hereford mp
text: the former hereford mp paul keetch , who 's died at the age of 56 , has been described as a man of `` absolute principle '' .
he was the area 's liberal democrat mp for 13 years from 1997 and died on wednesday after a long illness .
lib dem president baroness sal brinton said he `` cared passionately about the people he represented '' .
the party 's former leader lord campbell said mr keetch was `` an enthusiast in everything he did '' .
author: BBC Politics

documents.title: former redditch mp says counter-terror strategy needs reviewing
text: former home secretary jacqui smith says the prevent programme , aimed at stopping people becoming involved in extremism , must be reviewed .
the ex-redditch mp was involved in strengthening the programme in 2008 , but told bbc wm one of its main aims is still not happening .

the government were right to say that they should be reviewing it , but wrong to not have already done it , i think it needs to be looked at in more detail alongside other elements of the counter-terror strategy . ''

documents.title: former mp paul keetch dies
text: former county mp paul keetch has died aged 56 .
author: Hereford Times

documents.title: royal visit for residential farm
text: the duchess of cornwall is visiting a farm in herefordshire today , which organises breaks for disadvantaged young people .
jamie 's farm in longtown teaches children what is involved in running a livestock farm and skills like horse-care and carpentry .
the duchess is the patron of the charity and it 'll be her first visit to the herefordshire farm .

documents.title: delays on redditch to birmingham trains
text: train services between redditch and birmingham are facing delays and possible cancellations due to a points failure , which has left some lines blocked , operator london midland says .
due to a points failure between redditch and birmingham new street services running to and from these stations may be delayed or altered .
wat again for every cancellatuon you should not only be fined but passengers shl get free journey
we do get penalised but to be honest , i 'm sure how it would work when it 's beyond our control .
can i help at all ?
good
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: cricket : worcestershire take four northants wickets
text: worcestershire have taken four northamptonshire wickets in the morning session after winning the toss and choosing to bowl in their county championship game at the county ground .
there was one apiece for jack shantry , joe leach , josh tongue and ed barnard .
northants will return after the lunch break on 102-4 .
you can follow the match on bbc hereford and worcester on 738am and online .
author: Dave Bradley
Cricket commentator

documents.title: midlands today : extra security for 'pride ' event
text: west midlands police say a `` large number '' of officers , specials and staff will be on hand to keep visitors safe at the city 's pride event on saturday and sunday .
security measures have also been stepped up at festivals in staffordshire , shrewsbury and hay-on-wye .
catch my report on bbc one at 13:30 .
author: Ben Sidwell
BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: hereford sign bowen
text: james bowen is to return to edgar street , hereford fc have announced .
he spent time on-loan at the club in 2015-16 and manager peter beadle told the club 's website he was `` keen '' to get him back .
`` he 's had a lot of offers so i 'm pleased he 's agreed to join us , '' beadle said .

documents.title: bulls agree new deal with preece
text: hereford fc have agreed a new deal with defender mark preece .
the club 's website says the 29-year-old made 28 starts for the bulls last season , since joining from chippenham .

documents.title: man wanted on recall to prison
text: a man with links to kidderminster is wanted on recall to prison .
author: Kidderminster Shuttle

documents.title: hospital ward shut due to norovirus
text: a ward at hereford county hospital has been closed after a case of norovirus was confirmed .
the wye valley nhs trust says visits to the gilwern ward are on hold to prevent any further spread .
it says some patients are affected and adds that people should only come to the hospital if they need to .
author: Phil Maiden
Reporter, BBC Hereford & Worcester

documents.title: cricket : worcestershire strike early
text: worcestershire have made their first breakthrough in the third over , with joe leach removing northants ' max holden for a duck .
the score at the county ground is now 7-1 .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: minute 's silence observed as worcestershire 's game starts
text: the victims of the manchester bombing were remembered at the start of the game between northants and worcestershire .
minutes silence at wantage road for the victims of manchester terror attack impeccably observed

documents.title: cricket : worcestershire 's team for northants game
text: you can hear ball-by-ball commentary on bbc hereford & worcester 's 738am frequency and online .
worcs : mitchell d'oliveira fell clarke kohler-cadmore cox barnard leach lyon shantry tongue

documents.title: firm apologises after payroll system underpays council staff
text: the firm behind a new payroll system at worcestershire county council , which has seen staff and other businesses underpaid , has `` sincerely apologised '' .
almost 150 staff were affected after the authority brought in the new mercury payroll system in april , which covers 16,000 employees .
some workers saw their pay £ 500 short , a meeting of the full council heard on thursday , and the authority said a review would take place .
liberata , the firm that delivers the service , says it 's been working with the council `` to ensure that these errors do not re-occur in the next pay run '' .
author: BBC Hereford and Worcester

documents.title: music ban for worcester bar
text: the owners of a worcester bar were banned from playing music by a high court judge after they failed to apply for the correct licence .
author: Worcester News

documents.title: cricket : preview of northants v worcestershire
text: you can hear ball-by-ball commentary on bbc hereford & worcester 's 738am frequency and online .
sunny friday morning for northants v. worcestershire day 1 in the county championship .
author: Dave Bradley
Cricket commentator

documents.title: former hereford liberal democrat mp paul keetch dies
text: senior politicians have paid tribute to former hereford mp paul keetch who has died at the age of 56 .
mr keetch , who served as the area 's liberal democrat mp from 1997 to 2010 , was the party 's defence spokesperson and played a role in its decision to oppose involvement in the 2003 iraq war .
mr keetch died in london on wednesday following a long illness .
his family said he had been proud to represent hereford , where he was born .
author: BBC News England

documents.title: vigils held for manchester bomb victims
text: vigils will be held in redditch and kidderminster today , in memory of the victims of monday 's manchester attack .
further events will be held over the bank holiday weekend across the two counties , with vigils planned in bromsgrove and leominster on saturday .
naeem arif , from the bromsgrove muslim community trust , says all are welcome at this afternoon 's vigil at redditch mosque .

the horrific attack on manchester arena appalled all of us and whilst the extremists and terrorists want to divide communities we must come together for the victims and to send a strong message of unity to all those who wish to divide us . ''

documents.title: watch : your 50-second weather forecast
text: another dry , sunny and hot day in store with top temperatures of 25c ( 77f ) .
author: Mel Coles
BBC Weather

documents.title: payroll system underpays council staff
text: payroll system underpays council staff

it looks like being another scorcher - this bbc weather watcher was up early to catch the sun rising in evesham

documents.title: former post office partially collapses in town centre
text: structural engineers are examining an old post office on the horsefair , in kidderminster town centre , after it partially collapsed overnight .
roads had to be closed as the fire service attempted to make the building safe .
more on midlands today on bbc one at 18:30
author: BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: your love the hat
text: one of worcester 's community support officers experiments with some new head wear .
pcso cadwallader enjoying a spot of early morning engagement in the city centre # citycentre # cathedralsnt ( 40161 )
surely a candidate for intranet pic of the day @ twitterid another feather in pcso cadwallader 's cap !
ah big chief cadwallahuffer .
please tell me that was somehow issued headgear
is that the new police hats i 've read about
soooo many jokes ! !
how ?

documents.title: watch : the weather for tonight and tomorrow for the west midlands
text: after a hot , sunny day it looks like there 's more ahead - here 's the forecast for the next 24 hours .
you can also get the latest forecasts at any time from the bbc weather website .
author: Shefali Oza
BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: seven years in jail for teenage road killer
text: a driver has been jailed for seven years for killing a teenager while she used a pedestrian crossing in great barr , birmingham .
in february 2016 , zoe shapiro from malvern , was walking along the a34 birmingham road , on her way to college .
at a crossing she was struck by a van that was being driven by 43-year-old neel balu .
a jury at birmingham crown court heard that neel balu had a string of motoring convictions , including speeding and careless driving .
despite overwhelming evidence neel balu refused to accept that he drove in a dangerous manner which ultimately caused the death of causing zoe shapiro , however , a jury has today found him guilty .

documents.title: slideshow : up close and personal with nature
text: these beautiful close-up were taken by paul wilde in tiddesley wood near pershore .

documents.title: twin towns send messages of condolence and sympathy
text: two of the french towns twinned with worcester have expressed their horror at monday 's bomb attack in manchester which killed 22 people .
the mayor of le vesinet and the president of the vernon twinning association sent messages of condolence and sympathy to the mayor of worcester , steve mackay .
so many innocent lives have been stolen from us in manchester and words can not describe what french people are feeling , having been through such a terrible pain and trauma themselves
only together can we fight those who want to destroy us and destroy our values

documents.title: new chairman voted in for county council .
text: anne hingley is part of the ruling conservative group on worcestershire county council .
new chairman of # worcestershire county council elected unanimously as @ twitterid anne hingley , councillor for st barnabas # kidderminster

documents.title: van driver jailed for student death
text: van driver jailed for student death

documents.title: leader re-appointed at county council
text: simon geraghty is part of the ruling conservative group .
councillor simon geraghty , representing worcester riverside , is re-appointed as leader of # worcestershire county council .

documents.title: 'some teething problems ' say council as staff underpaid
text: there are `` some teething problems '' with a new payroll system which have led to hundreds of staff experiencing delays in getting pay , worcestershire county council say .

the council insists the new system , which covers 16,000 worcestershire county council employees , maintained schools and academies , will be `` more efficient '' and will help it move away from paper-based systems .
the systems have been live since april .
as with any change of this scale there have been some teething problems .
with our partner liberata , who we chose to deliver the new system because of their experience in this field , we are working through these issues and resolving them as quickly as we can . ''

documents.title: travel : speed restrictions to be lifted on 'smart ' motorway
text: the section of the m5 motorway from worcester to the m42 has been converted into a `` smart '' motorway , where speed limits and the number of lanes drivers can use can be varied at peak times .
speed limits have been in place since january last year .
50mph speed restrictions on new # worcs m5 smart motorway j6-j5 to be lifted later today - confirmed by @ twitterid
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: slideshow : butterflies and blue skies
text: the sunny weather has given the bbc 's army of weather watchers the chance to get some great
this selection come from postman les , janiejane13 , johnqa , morning amble and chris'n'ginny .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: schools only to be used as polling stations as 'last resort '
text: the council say 25 schools were used during the last elections , out of a total of 376 polling stations .
# worcestershire county council approves motion to seek to avoid using schools for polling stations at elections except as 'last resort '

documents.title: police act over city centre 'encampment '
text: the encampment is on the car park opposite the hive library and history centre in worcester .
city centre team and cathedral snt along with worcester city council , served notice on encampment at croft road

documents.title: man who started fire on plane has sentence doubled
text: a man who started a fire in the toilet of a plane carrying more than 200 people has had his prison sentence more than doubled at the court of appeal .

in january at birmingham crown court , john cox , 46 , pleaded guilty to an offence of arson being reckless as to whether life was endangered and was later sentenced to four years and six months in jail .
cox , of coates road , kidderminster , had been drinking before and during the flight , and was rude , abusive and very aggressive when challenged by passengers and crew .
the appeal judges agreed with the attorney general that the sentence imposed was unduly lenient and increased it to nine years and six months .
the level of culpability and potential for harm is at the highest level .
to throw a cigarette butt into a wastepaper bin without ensuring it is extinguished would show a high degree of recklessness .
on an aircraft at 33,000 ft , the conduct comes perilously close to deliberate fire-setting .
it was an exceptional case and called for a deterrent sentence .
author: Monica Rimmer
Journalist, BBC Online

documents.title: staff underpaid by 'horrendous ' new payroll system , council hears
text: a new payroll system brought in by worcestershire county council has been labelled as `` horrendous '' and `` not fit for purpose '' after more than 150 staff and other businesses experienced delays in getting pay .

councillors raised a series of `` serious failings '' in the new mercury payroll system brought in april , which saw 16,000 county , school and academy staff transferred from paper-based systems to automated ones .
the full meeting of the council heard some staff had seen their pay £ 500 short , while others had received threatening letters from pension schemes after their contributions were stopped .
the council said a review would start on 12 june but felt imposing penalties on the company running the scheme was probably `` inappropriate '' .
author: Alistair Binney
Reporter, BBC Hereford & Worcester

documents.title: watch : minute 's silence observed at council meeting
text: councillors at the worcestershire county council meeting joined people from across the country at 11:00 in observing a minute 's silence in honour of the manchester bomb victims .
worcestershire county council staff observed a minute 's silence at 11am today to pay their respects following the attack in # manchester

documents.title: derelict post office collapses
text: derelict post office collapses

documents.title: butcher 's shop in poolbrook is saved from closure
text: a neighbourhood butcher 's shop in malvern has been saved from closure by the intervention of a local businesswoman .
author: Malvern Gazette

documents.title: water charity stops using plastic bottles
text: a herefordshire charity which funds water projects in india and nepal by selling bottled water in the uk claims it 's the first brand in the country to abandon using plastic bottles .
frank water , based in colwall , now only sells water in glass bottles for environmental reasons .
the charity 's ceo katie alcott says it 's time to stop making convenience our only priority and start thinking ahead instead .

documents.title: we must not let hate-mongers divide us : vigil organiser
text: a vigil will take place in bromsgrove on saturday to remember the victims of the bomb attack in manchester .
it 's been organised by the bromsgrove muslim community trust and bromsgrove district council and will be held in the parkside suite , at the council house , at 12:30 .
terrorism has no religious or moral standing .
no faith or belief can ever justify the killing of innocent people .
we must not let any hate-mongers divide us , but show them that people of all faiths and none can live peacefully , together

documents.title: boyfriend speaks about accident in which teen lost an arm
text: the boyfriend of a worcestershire teenager has described the moment his partner lost his arm at a railway station .

dominic preece ( below right ) , who is 17 and has learning difficulties , had to have his arm amputated after falling on to the tracks at droitwich spa railway station alongside a moving train earlier this month .
his boyfriend tom holford says dominic ran towards the train after realising he 'd left his bag on it .

the doors had closed , the train was moving , so dominic decided to run after the train - the next thing a member of the public said he 'd fallen over , i ran down the platform and found him on the tracks with his arm hanging off
network rail says its investigation is ongoing .
train operator london midland says it is also investigating this `` very tragic accident '' .

documents.title: train fall teen 'saved by boyfriend '
text: train fall teen 'saved by boyfriend '

documents.title: ambulance service marks minute 's silence
text: the silence was observed all across the country at 11:00 .
we stand with manchester

documents.title: watch : wing walking at 64
text: a woman who 's already raised more than £ 20,000 for various cancer charities has completed a wing walk to raise more money .
rosie browse,64 , from malvern , raises funds in memory of her late husband ian , who died in 2011 .
author: BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: station safety criticised by mother after son loses arm
text: a mother whose son lost his arm when he fell on to the rail tracks alongside a moving train is calling for safety improvements at the station .
kerry preece says the gap between trains and the platform at droitwich spa railway station is too wide .
dominic preece , from kidderminster , who 's 17 and has learning difficulties , left his bag on the train earlier this month and fell on to the track while chasing after it .
network rail says as the investigation is continuing , it 's unable to comment any further .
train operator london midland described it as a `` tragic accident '' and said it was investigating all the circumstances .
i 'd like to see the gap closed off at droitwich because you get off the train there and the gap is horrendous - you literally have to jump from the train to the platform

documents.title: ambulance staff join minute 's silence
text: a minute 's silence in memory of the manchester bomb victims is being held at 11:00 .
we are inviting all of our staff to mark the minute 's silence at 11am to show our # solidarity with # manchester and all those affected
if not on a job i will observe the silence
a single red rose why we love our emergency services me x paramedicgrahamsings
send a single white rose why pure innocence me x paramedicgrahamsings

documents.title: football : shrewsbury sign harriers ' striker
text: shrewsbury town have signed the kidderminster harriers striker arthur gnahoua .
the 24-year-old scored 15 goals for the national league north side last season .
the football club says he is joining on a one-year deal .

documents.title: watch : partial collapse of building closes town centre roads
text: a building has partially collapsed in kidderminster , causing road closures in the town .
hereford & worcester fire and rescue service is dealing with the collapse at the back of the old post office , in the horsefair .
police have closed the corner of the horsefair and radford avenue .
author: Justyn Surrall
BBC Hereford and Worcester

text: extra security warning at hay festival

text: 'writers phrase things differently '

text: a minute 's silence is being observed across the country in memory of the manchester bomb victims .
we will be observing a minute silence at 11am today for victims of the # manchester attack , feel free to join us .
# prayformanchester

documents.title: rugby : warriors ' legend back as community ambassador
text: tonga international aleki lutui will be returning to sixways as a community ambassador , passing on his experience to youngsters who attend warriors ' rugby camps and other events , the club says .
the hooker left the club in 2013 and is warriors ' fifth highest appearance maker of all time , having played 186 games during seven years as a player at sixways .

documents.title: watch : teen 'comes to terms ' with losing his arm
text: a worcestershire mother whose son lost his arm when he fell on to a rail track alongside a moving train says he is a `` remarkable young man '' who is in high spirits despite all that has happened to him .
kerry preece 's son dominic , who is 17 and has learning difficulties , left his bag on the train earlier this month and fell on to the track as he ran after it .
she is now fundraising for a prosthetic arm for her son .
author: Justyn Surrall
BBC Hereford and Worcester

documents.title: cricket : moeen man of the match as england win
text: worcestershire 's moeen ali was named man of the match as england beat south africa by 72 runs in the first of three one-day internationals .
moeen launched leg-spinner imran tahir for three sixes in an over to bring up a 35-ball half-century - he also took 2-50 with the ball .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: drugs , sex and dogs - 'problem ' wood closed
text: a wood in worcestershire is being closed after complaints of drug dealing , illicit sexual activity and problems with out of control dogs .
the woodlands trust says it 's the first time its had to do this - but it had to take action because the uffmoor wood has become one of their most `` problematic '' sites .
find out more on midlands today at 18:30 on bbc one .

documents.title: weather : warm and humid as sunshine to stay
text: remember to keep the suncream handy , folks .
author: Shefali Oza
BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: figures released for unauthorised access to police records
text: in the past three years , 16 west mercia police staff have faced disciplinary action for looking up people 's police records for unofficial reasons , figures released by the force in response to a freedom of information request reveal .
eight of those proceedings involved police constables and two involved sergeants , with the remainder concerning community officers and backroom staff .
two people ended up being dismissed as a result of this disciplinary action and another two resigned , the force has said .

documents.title: your basking dragonflies
text: these dragonflies are clearly enjoying the sunny weather .
thanks to bbc weather watcher , funkyfownhope , for the photo - you can send any you are proud of by email , tweet us on @ twitterid or message via facebook .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: scammers target computer users after 'ransomware ' attack
text: computer users are being warned by police scammers are using the recent 'ransomware ' attack to con people .
west mercia police say one person was persuaded to pay £ 350 for a free piece of microsoft software by scammers , after giving remote access to their computer .
police are warning people not to call numbers that appear in 'pop-up ' windows , or to give remote access to their computer after an unsolicited call .

documents.title: roger curry : bail extended in kidnap case
text: a 51-year-old man from taunton , who was arrested on sus of kidnapping an elderly american who was found wandering in hereford , has had his bail extended until july .
pensioner roger curry , who has dementia , was identified by an investigation by the bbc panorama team
he was looked after in a care home in herefordshire after he was found in november 2015 .
mr curry is now in the care of the los angeles health authorities .

documents.title: new 'interim ' chief executive about to be appointed at worcestershire county council
text: a new `` interim '' chief executive is about to be appointed at worcestershire county council for up to nine months , it has emerged .
author: Malvern Gazette

documents.title: basketball : wolves re-sign khan
text: worcester wolves have re-signed ashton khan for his third season with the team .
khan first joined the wolves for the 2015-16 campaign and last season produced some outstanding and consistent performances , averaging eight points and three assists per game .
author: BBC Hereford and Worcester

documents.title: slideshow : sunny views and spring flowers
text: the sunny weather means that the bbc 's weather watchers have been out and about photographing some great views .
thanks to mikesnapper , toppo , highwayman , janiejane13 and fuzzballpc for this selection .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: 'we 're gutted to go to this level of action '
text: a representative from the woodland trust has told how saddened they are to close a wood because of 'dogging ' and drug abuse .
we reported yesterday uffmoor wood , near halesowen , had been closed after the antisocial behaviour got out of control and were making other visitors feel unsafe .

essentially what 's happening is people are timing their visits to make sure they can avoid certain characters in the car park , or feel intimated by other dog owners or other woodland visitors and not feeling safe in the woods .
we 're absolutely gutted to go to this level of action .
author: Rebecca Woods
BBC News Online, Journalist

documents.title: cricket : moeen in squad for first one-day international
text: england are taking on south africa at headingley in the first of three one-day internationals .
worcestershire 's moeen ali is part of the squad - the game got underway at 14:00 and you can follow all the action on the bbc sport live page .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: police call for community to work together following manchester attack
text: people in shropshire , herefordshire and worcestershire are being asked to work together to fight terrorism , in the wake of the manchester attack .

the assistant chief constable of west mercia police , martin evans , said : `` this is a time for us all to work closely together and unite against those who seek , through violence and extremism , to intimidate or cause fear . ''
the force says it has increased the number of armed officers on patrol around the three counties , but said there was no intelligence of a likely attack .
it also says it has plans in place , if military personnel have to be deployed alongside armed police .

documents.title: do n't let terrorists stop you enjoying the weekend , says police chief
text: a worcestershire police commander has urged people to enjoy the bank holiday weekend as usual , despite the uk 's terror threat being raised to critical .
author: Malvern Gazette

documents.title: first president of new university appointed
text: an international academic and entrepreneur has been appointed as the first president and chief executive of the new engineering university in hereford .
prof janusz kozinski recently helped set up the lassonde school of engineering in toronto , canada .
the new university , yet to be named , is due to open in 2020 and will eventually be home to 5,000 students .
this is perhaps the brightest and the boldest academic start-up in recent times in the uk or anywhere else .
the chance to lead this project was impossible to resist

documents.title: worcestershire 's police chiefs prepare 'appropriate plans ' after uk terror threat is raised
text: police in worcestershire are reviewing how they manage crowded places and pre-planned events after the uk 's terror threat level was raised to critical .
author: Bromsgrove Advertiser

documents.title: slideshow : sunshine on a spring day
text: there have been plenty of glorious images for bbc weather watchers to capture as the spring sunshine beats down .
thanks to morning amble , johnqa , pugwashpt and solar power for the
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: 'deepest sympathies ' offered by council leader
text: the `` countless acts of bravery and kindness throughout manchester '' have been praised by the leader of wychavon district council , in a letter of sympathy sent to the mayor of greater manchester .
the council is flying the flag at its headquarters in pershore at half mast .
it is inspiring to see the countless acts of bravery and kindness throughout manchester as they stand together and strong through this difficult time .
we offer our sincere condolences and support , and our thoughts and prayers are with the victims , and the families and friends who have lost loved ones

documents.title: wing walk in memory of husband
text: a worcestershire woman , who 's already raised more than £ 20,000 for various cancer charities , will embark on her biggest challenge yet later today .
rosie browse , 64 , from malvern , will wing walk in memory of her late husband ian , who died in 2011 .
a wing walk is something she says she 's always wanted to do and she does n't think she 'll be scared .
it 's something i think i 'm going to enjoy after waiting so many years to do it
she is due to fly at 15:00 from gloucestershire airport , in cheltenham .

documents.title: no specific threat in herefordshire , worcestershire or shropshire : police
text: security `` in crowded places and for pre-planned events '' will be reviewed in the wake of the suicide attack in manchester , west mercia police say .
assistant chief constable martin evans says there is `` no intelligence to suggest a specific threat '' in herefordshire , shropshire or worcestershire .
he said operation temperer now allowed the deployment of military personnel alongside and in support of police firearms officers .
if they are deployed in the west mercia police area , soldiers will `` remain under the command and control of the police service '' , he added .

documents.title: slideshow : swans swimming , nesting and sleeping
text: these great photos of swans around forge mill pond , in redditch , were taken by paul wilde , one of our regular contributors and the king of close-up .
i 'd love to feature your photos on this page - you can email , tweet us @ twitterid or message via facebook .
author: Jerry Chester
BBC News Online

documents.title: 'pile of junk ' reaches finals of shed of the year competition
text: a humble garden hut at a property in the worcestershire countryside , which started life as a heap of wooden panels salvaged from another structure , has reached the finals of the shed of the year 2017 competition .
author: Worcester News

documents.title: new top cop pledges to make force more 'efficient and effective '
text: the new assistant chief constable for west mercia police begins work today , promising to use new technology to make the force more efficient and effective .
martin evans will oversee the introduction of mobile data devices and body worn video .
he was born in shropshire , and joined staffordshire police in 1987 where he served in a number of different roles .

documents.title: free plants on offer at city park
text: if you are looking for some plants to brighten up your garden , there are some free ones on offer at cripplegate park , in worcester .
people can take plants from the annuals beds in the park - staff will be on hand to offer advice .
plants can be taken from 10:00-12:30 - bring your own plastic bags , gloves and trowels .

documents.title: vigil to be held for suicide attack victims
text: a vigil remembering the victims of the manchester terror attack will be held in bromsgrove later this week .
friday 's event is being organised by waqar azmi , a spokesperson for the british muslim forum , and will be open to all faiths .
he says the muslim community fears a backlash but believes most people understand they 're not to blame for extremism .

documents.title: joy for writer as rsc stages his play
text: a worcester playwright says it 's beyond his dreams to have another one of his productions performed by the royal shakespeare company .
phil porter 's play vice versa recently opened at the swan theatre in stratford , with the rsc producing and performing it .
he says the rsc has always been particularly supportive of his works .
i 've been at it for 15 or 20 years and it 's sort of happened gradually .
you just keep writing new plays and new projects and they gradually get bigger as long as they go well

documents.title: stourport baby fitted with helmet following appeal to help fund treatment
text: a stourport baby has been fitted with a special helmet to help treat her rare skull defect - shortly after her mother issued a heartfelt plea to help raise funds for the treatment .
author: Kidderminster Shuttle

documents.title: ww1 refugee link remembered in flag ceremony
text: the people of herefordshire and worcestershire who welcomed belgian refugees into their homes a century ago were honoured in a special ceremony in hereford last tonight .

hereford was the first city in the uk to offer hospitality to belgians fleeing from their homeland - 102 years ago a small group of refugees presented the city with a hand-made silk flag in gratitude for all that had been done for them .
stuart dove 's mother , irene , fled belgium as a baby - he 's donated a replica flag to hereford town hall which was dedicated alongside the newly restored original .
author: Nicola Goodwin
Reporter, BBC Hereford & Worcester

documents.title: man fights for boyfriend 's life after he loses arm in train accident
text: a man fought to save his boyfriend 's life after he got his arm caught in a train travelling to bromsgrove .
author: Bromsgrove Advertiser

documents.title: manchester attack : 'i think probably over the next few days it will sink in '
text: a worcester woman caught up in the attack in manchester says the enormity of what happened still has n't sunk in .
lydia watkins and her 11-year-old daughter madison were at monday night 's ariana grande concert and were left stranded in the city overnight .
lydia says her daughter is recovering from the shock of what happened to them .
she 's a lot better .
a local hotel put us up for the night , which was very nice of them , so she 's had a bit of a sleep .
i think probably over the next few days it will sink in for both of us
author: BBC Hereford and Worcester

documents.title: watch : your 50-second weather forecast
text: it will be another dry day with partly cloudy skies .
there will be increasing bright or sunny spells through the afternoon and it will feel warm in light winds .
highs of 23c ( 73f ) .
author: Charlie Slater
BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: good morning from today 's herefordshire and worcestershire live page
text: welcome to the local live service for herefordshire and worcestershire on wednesday morning .
weather watcher tubbsnook53 took this amazing of a sea of mist across worcestershire , seen from the malvern hills .
i 'll be bringing you all the news , sport , travel and weather as it happens .
if you 'd like to get in touch you can email , tweet us @ twitterid or message via facebook .

BBC News Online

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: we 'll be back with our usual mix of news , sport , travel and weather from 08:00 tomorrow , but keep an eye out here for more updates this evening and into the morning .

documents.title: football : harriers announce pre-season derby games
text: kidderminster harriers have arranged two more high-profile pre-season games ahead of the new football season .
they will play birmingham city on 26 july and west bromwich albion on 1 august .
author: BBC Hereford and Worcester

documents.title: weather : what will wednesday bring ?
text: we 're expecting more of the same tomorrow with cloud remaining over most of the region .
it might be a little warmer though , with temperatures forecast to reach 22c ( 72f ) .
author: Charlie Slater
BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: gold medal ambitions for canoeist
text: a canoeist from worcester canoe club says she 's aiming for gold in tokyo 2020 after up a silver at the world championships in portugal .
sian mills ( below left ) won the 200m canoe sprint in the first of three races making coming second in the finals .

documents.title: hundreds gathered to remember those who lost their lives during the falklands war
text: more than 700 people enjoyed a concert by the band of the royal marines plymouth on saturday evening to commemorate the 35th anniversary of the argentine invasion of the falkland islands .
author: Hereford Times

documents.title: allegations a resident was strapped into bed overnight
text: allegations a resident at a worcestershire care home was strapped into their bed overnight are being investigated , police have confirmed .
west mercia police say they are investigating after reports of `` an incident '' at lickey hills care home earlier this month .
a spokesperson for the home says the allegations are being taken `` extremely seriously '' but its initial findings show there is `` no evidence to suggest velcro straps were used '' on a resident .
the home says it is `` working closely with police and other agencies '' .
author: Alistair Binney
Reporter, BBC Hereford & Worcester

documents.title: how many weapons can you see ?
text: police in worcester have issued this challenge .
all of this found on a male who high on drugs .
how many potential weapons can you see # staysafe # knifecrime
seven .
keys can easily become weapons !
nine , anything can become a potential weapon .
i 've been attacked by a ruler , used in the right way they are lethal !
hi , where was this male found and was he arrested/charged ?
if so what was he arrested/charged for ?
thanks , matt ( worcester news ) .

documents.title: your photos : broadway and arley
text: you 've been sharing all sorts of photos via the bbc midlands today facebook page .
they include this pair , taken in broadway ( top ) and arley ( below ) .
author: BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: cathedrals are a 'focus for prayer , reflection and comfort ' says dean
text: the dean of hereford cathedral says its 'thoughts and prayers '' are with the victims of the suicide bombing in manchester , as well as with `` the bereaved , the injured and the emergency services '' .

we know that at times like these , cathedrals become a focus for prayer , reflection and comfort , and we 'll be thinking of the community at manchester cathedral as they seek to offer support and comfort at this most difficult time . ''

documents.title: homeless charity is mayor 's choice
text: charities helping homeless people and people with mental health issues have been chosen by the new mayor of redditch for support in her year in office .
jenny wheeler was elected mayor at last night 's annual meeting of redditch borough council .

documents.title: prayers instead of hustings
text: election hustings due to take place at pershore baptist church tonight have been cancelled .
in their place the organisers , churches together in pershore , are to hold a short service at 19:00 .
there will be candles and periods of silence for reflection and prayer as people remember those who have been affected by the suicide bombing in manchester .
author: Alistair Binney
Reporter, BBC Hereford & Worcester

documents.title: suspected 'potent ' drug fentanyl seized
text: suspected 'potent ' drug fentanyl seized

documents.title: seriously ill dog dumped from van
text: a seriously ill dog has been `` heartlessly '' dumped from a van in redditch , the rspca say .
despite being taken to a vets after a member of the public reported the incident , the dog was later put down .
the animal welfare charity is appealing for anyone who has information about the female shar pei to come forward .
this poor dog was heartlessly abandoned in the most callous way in her hour of need .
it 's heartbreaking to think such a poorly dog was simply dumped and left to die . ''
the dog was abandoned in edgeworth close , redditch , at around midnight on thursday .

documents.title: kidderminster 's new civic leader chosen
text: conservative councillor nicky gale has been elected as kidderminster 's new mayor for the forthcoming municipal year .
author: Kidderminster Shuttle

documents.title: rugby : warriors ' talisman selected for boks tour
text: worcester warriors ' scrum half francois hougaard has been named in the springboks ' squad for their test series against france .
congratulations to @ twitterid who 's in a 31-man squad for south africa ahead of their series against france .
big congrats on the selection !
please come back fighting fit in september ready to climb the prem table # warriors
lets hope francois does n't get another serious injury that sidelines him for most of the warriors season again !
speel sterk en veilige terugkeer hopefully i have n't just sworn at you !
congratulations , well deserved !
inevitable he is a machine for you guys and probably one of the best springboks ever .

documents.title: children taken to hospital after two-car collision
text: three people , including two children , have been taken to hospital following a collision in llangrove in herefordshire , the ambulance service say .
it happened at about 08:00 and involved two cars .
a seven-year-old boy and 11-year-old girl were taken to hereford county hospital suffering from head and chest injuries and back pain .

documents.title: flag at half mast at police hq
text: west mercia police has become the latest organisation to fly its flag at half mast out of respect for the victims of the manchester suicide attack .
the flag at our west mercia hq is flying at half mast in honour of those involved and affected by last night 's events in # manchester
that 'll stop um

documents.title: flag at half mast in worcester
text: more signs of respects for the victims of the manchester suicide attack .
our thoughts are with the people of manchester at this terrible time .
guildhall flag is at half-mast today as a mark of respect .

documents.title: 'i was really scared because i could n't breath '
text: a girl caught up in the crowd running out of the manchester arena after a suicide attack said she was `` scared and confused '' as she was in the crush to escape .
lydia watkins says she and her daughter madison , from worcester , were caught up in `` a sea of people running towards us shouting 'run , run , run ' '' .
i was really scared because i could n't breathe .
we did n't know what was happening and everyone started running and i was really confused . ''

documents.title: 'new and particularly dangerous drug ' seized in malvern
text: a `` new and particularly dangerous drug '' , similar to heroin but `` many times more potent '' has been seized in a police raid .
west mercia police say they seized what they believe to be `` a controlled substance , possibly fentanyl '' , which they describe as `` an extremely potent '' synthetic painkiller .
the raid took place yesterday at a property on yates hay road in malvern
we advise anyone from the drug-using community who thinks they may have been exposed to this drug or who is experiencing unexpected symptoms to seek urgent medical attention . ''

documents.title: support for bomb victims from people of 'whatever faith or none '
text: more sympathy offered on social media to the victims of the suicide attack in manchester .
our prayers with all good people of whatever faith or none , go to the injured & bereaved of # manchester .
may they know god 's peace

documents.title: 'thoughts and prayers ' with victims says police chief
text: more reaction to the suicide attack in manchester in which at least 22 people have died .
our thoughts and prayers are with those killed & injured in # manchester @ twitterid # westandtogether

documents.title: in-form worcs a match for anyone - leach
text: in-form worcs a match for anyone - leach

documents.title: 'it was just panic - like everything was in slow motion ''
text: a mother who had taken her daughter to the ariana grande concert in manchester says there was `` chaos '' in the aftermath of the bomb going off , as they were caught up in the stampede to get out of the venue .
lydia watkins and daughter madison , from worcester , were caught up in a stampede to get out of the venue .
she said she ca n't believe anyone could target an audience made up of mothers and their daughters .
you are thinking about family , friends , will you ever see them again , how will you contact them - it was just crazy . ''

documents.title: two worcester restaurants receive 'one star ' hygiene rating
text: two restaurants have been given a 'one star ' food hygiene rating within the space of a week .
author: Worcester News

documents.title: tree and plaque honour munitions workers
text: two former munitions workers were the guests of honour as a special tree was planted at county hall in worcester yesterday .
a black pear tree and a plaque were unveiled in memory of the hundreds of people who worked in the bullet factory at blackpole in the city during both world wars .
hereford & worcester has been campaigning for a national honour for munitions workers since january .

documents.title: five arrested in hunt investigation have been re-bailed
text: five people who were arrested on sus of animal cruelty at the south herefordshire hunt 's kennels in wormelow have been re-bailed .
author: Hereford Times

documents.title: beauty spot closed due to persistent 'anti-social behaviour '
text: the woodland trust says it is closing down one of its worcestershire sites because of anti-social behaviour .

the charity says despite numerous campaigns , uffmoor wood near romsley has a growing problem with violent and out of control dogs , drug use and sexual activity , and many of its members say they feel `` unsafe '' .

documents.title: woman stabbed after stopping to help man
text: a woman has been stabbed after stopping to help a man she saw lying in the road .
she was driving along lea end lane in alvechurch , worcestershire when she came across the man .
when she got out of her car to help she was attacked by a second man and stabbed .
she managed to drive away but was later taken to the queen elizabeth hospital in birmingham with stab wounds which are not life-threatening .
police are appealing for witnesses to the incident , which happened at about 15.20 wednesday , 17 may .

documents.title: terror attack : 'our thoughts are with those affected ' say police
text: west mercia police have tweeted their support for those caught up in the terror attack in manchester .
the thoughts of our officers and staff are with those involved in and affected by last night 's events in # manchester

documents.title: flag at half mast after manchester terror attack
text: the civic flag is at half mast at wychavon district council .
our flag is at half mast for those who lost their lives in manchester .
our thoughts and prayers are with the friends and family affected .
hello , could we use this on the evesham observer website ?
hi joshua , yes that 's fine .
not a problem .
thank you !

documents.title: west mids ambulance crews help manchester colleagues
text: ambulance crews from the west midlands were sent into the north west of england last night in the wake of last night 's suicide attack at manchester arena .
crews provided support to the north west ambulance service while they dealt with the incident , west midlands ambulance service said .
`` these resources have now been stood down and returned to their normal operating areas , '' a spokesman said .
`` we would like to thank the many staff who offered to stay late and work additional shifts . ''
the manchester incident emergency phone number 0161 856 9400 .

documents.title: massive mound of waste dumped in country land
text: about 20 tonnes of waste has been dumped on land off a country lane in worcestershire .
the pile , estimated to be about 15ft ( 4.6m ) high , was found by a press photographer out taking of the sunset on sunday in frankley .
bromsgrove district council says the rubbish has been there for a few weeks and it 's offered to help the landowner move it .

documents.title: video : your 50-second weather forecast
text: after a cloudy morning , there will be some bright and sunny spells with top temperatures of 21c ( 70f ) .
author: Charlie Slater
BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: good morning from today 's herefordshire and worcestershire live page
text: welcome to the local live service for herefordshire and worcestershire on tuesday morning .
i 'll be bringing you all the news , sport , travel and weather as it happens .
if you 'd like to get in touch you can email , tweet us on @ twitterid or message via facebook .
author: Jerry Chester
BBC News Online

documents.title: the rave to end all raves
text: the rave to end all raves

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: we 'll be back with our usual mix of news , sport , travel and weather from 08:00 tomorrow , but keep an eye out here for more updates this evening and into the morning .

documents.title: 'no tipping ' signpost added after huge pile dumped on land
text: a landowner has been left to foot the bill of removing a huge pile of rubbish after it was dumped just off a country lane outside birmingham .
bromsgrove district council said it was made aware of the fly-tipping about `` a few weeks '' ago , as well as the environment agency , police , county and parish councils and even the local mp .
the sign warning people not to fly-tip in the area was in fact added to the gate post after the offence bromsgrove district council said in a bid to support the landowner .

documents.title: a pear tree for worcester 's 'canary girls '
text: a black pear tree has been planted at county hall in worcester in honour of the men and women who worked at the city 's blackpole munitions factory during the two world wars .
two former workers at the bullet plant , kathleen halford and kathleen smith attended the ceremony which also saw a plaque put up beside the tree .
the skin of many of the women turned yellow as a result of working with trinitrotoluene - more commonly known as tnt , which is why they were called `` canary girls '' .
about a million women worked at thousands of ministry of munitions sites during both world wars , but how many died remains a mystery .
a campaign led by bbc hereford and worcester hopes to see records of how many workers died released , as well as to cement the place of munitions workers in war history .
author: Nicola Goodwin
Reporter, BBC Hereford & Worcester

documents.title: uffmoor wood closed as 'last resort ' by woodland trust bosses
text: doggers and drug dealers have forced the closure of a beauty spot near romsley .
author: Bromsgrove Advertiser

documents.title: weather : a mild night and more sun tomorrow
text: we 're forecast a mild and overcast night , with temperatures not expected to fall below 10c ( 50f ) .
tomorrow we can expect more sunshine and temperatures up to 22c ( 72f ) .
author: Alex Hamilton
BBC Weather

documents.title: worcester canoeist takes silver
text: worcester canoeist sian mills has taken silver in the world championships in portugal .
she was successful in a doubles sprint event , the c2 , 200 metres with partner nia tomos .
author: Claudia Berry
Producer, BBC Hereford & Worcester

documents.title: your photos : another great day to enjoy the outdoors
text: whether it 's a woodland walk in bromsgrove , or a stroll through open fields in wolverley , the return of fine weather makes this a great day to get outside .
thanks to bbc weather watchers revsweather and weather geek for these stunning

documents.title: nine in court over drone jail smuggling op
text: nine people have appeared in court charged with conspiring to use drones to fly drugs , weapons and other contraband into several jails .
hmp hewell in redditch , hmp stoke heath in shropshire , hmp winson green in birmingham and hmp featherstone near wolverhampton are all believed to have been targeted .
as well as using drones , the two women and seven men are also accused of throwing contraband over prison walls .
the nine are charged with conspiring to supply prohibited items into prisons between july 2015 and january 2017 .
they are next set to appear at birmingham crown court on 23 june .
another two alleged co-conspirators are due to appear before magistrates later this week .
author: Mike Perkins
Newsreader, BBC Hereford & Worcester

documents.title: cat trapped between two garages
text: fire crews in evesham have rescued a cat that was stuck between the walls of two garages .
firefighters had to use a hammer and chisel to remove some concrete so they could reach the cat .
the rspca helped in the rescue in the hodges at around 10:00 this morning .

documents.title: witness appeal following burglary
text: machinery and money are among items stolen during a burglary in kidderminster town centre .
author: Kidderminster Shuttle

documents.title: peregrines choose worcestershire church to raise family
text: members of a church in broadway are understandably proud of their latest edition to the congregation , after they spotted a baby peregrine in the stone work .
two adult peregrines were seen nesting in st michael and all angels c of e church last spring and this year the pair have successfully hatched an egg .

we first noticed the baby a week ago , but were very careful not to tweet about it until we knew the young one could fly and we 're in touch with the worcestershire wildlife trust about how we can protect them next year . ''
author: Claudia Berry
Producer, BBC Hereford & Worcester

documents.title: leach leads worcs to victory at derby
text: leach leads worcs to victory at derby

documents.title: navigating the a49 diversion with a smile on your face
text: if you 're unlucky enough to be a passenger stuck in car navigating a near 60-mile diversion next month , we 've compiled a list of films you might want to download to keep you entertained - titles courtesy of the imdb website .
according to google , the 57.4-mile official diversion is expected to take 94 minutes ( longer during peak times ) .
that 's enough time to catch one of these films ( in duration order ) :

documents.title: castlemorton common 25 years on : 'just one party that slipped through the police net '
text: one of the estimated 20,000 people who descended on castlemorton common near malvern 25 years ago has described the week-long event as `` just one party that slipped through the net '' .
within two years the police were given more powers to stop and break up large open-air gatherings where loud music was being played .
we just found a mate with car , got as many people into the car as we could , drove over from worcester and just spent as long as we could here . ''
the event went down in history as the biggest illegal rave ever held in the uk .
it resulted in a trial costing £ 4m and the passing of the criminal justice and public order act .

documents.title: worcs seal stunning win over northants
text: worcs seal stunning win over northants

documents.title: huge pile of waste dumped in field next to 'no tipping ' sign
text: a huge pile of waste has been dumped just off a country lane in a field in frankley , near birmingham .
the load was dumped metres from an environment agency sign saying `` no tipping '' .
countryside # flytipping # birmingham # westmidlands

documents.title: worcestershire ruthless at derbyderbyshire 275 & 34-6 ( 10.5 overs ) , worcestershire 415-9 dec
text: worcestershire 's bowlers have got their tails up at derby .
behind by 140 runs after the first innings , the home side are currently 34-6
visiting captain joe leach took two wickets in an over after lunch .
follow all the action on bbc hereford & worcester on 738am and online .
'what have i done ? ! '
running your team-mate out is a lonely business
@ twitterid that 's bartons favourite thing to do

documents.title: hgvs face longest detour during a49 works
text: work at onibury railway crossing this summer will lead to a 60-mile diversion , according to an official route .

while local drivers will no doubt find their own way around the works , it 's a different matter for heavy goods vehicles which ca n't use many of the same back roads - which the official diversion has to bear in mind .
a large lorry heading from ludlow or leominster to craven arms or church stretton ( or vice versa ) faces the biggest detour we think .

documents.title: worcestershire 's morning at derbyderbyshire 275 & 33-4 ( 10 overs ) , worcestershire 415-9 dec
text: derbyshire have reached lunch on 33-4 , still needing 107 runs to avoid an innings defeat .

more quick wickets will be needed by the visitors this afternoon if they are to pull off a third successive county championship win , an unlikely victory after rain badly interrupted play on the first two days ,
catch all the final-day action on bbc hereford & worcester on 738am and online .
author: Dave Bradley
Cricket commentator

documents.title: teenager jailed for dealing drugs faces deportation
text: a teenage drug dealer who supplied heroin and crack cocaine in worcester and pershore has been jailed and could soon be deported .
author: Worcester News

documents.title: worcestershire chase win at derby
text: worcestershire have declared on 415-9 as they chase an unlikely victory in derby .
tom kohler-cadmore top-scored today with 42 , but it was centuries from brett d'oliveira ( 150 ) and daryl mitchell ( 120 ) yesterday that put the visitors in control - they lead by 140 .
quick wickets will be needed if there 's any chance for worcestershire .
follow the action on bbc hereford & worcester on 738am and online .
author: Dave Bradley
Cricket commentator

documents.title: hereford 'beefy boy ' dies
text: one of hereford 's beefy boys , who came runners up at an international burger making competition , has died .
police say alex evans 's body was found at a house in st martin 's street in hereford on saturday and they 're treating his death as unexplained .
the beefy boys claimed a silver medal at the world 's best burger competition in las vegas in 2014 .

documents.title: your photos : amazing sunsets
text: yesterday 's sunset produced some incredible skies over herefordshire .
thanks to bbc weather watchers postman les in bromyard and happysnapper71 in eaton bishop for these beautiful photographs .
author: Claudia Berry
Producer, BBC Hereford & Worcester

documents.title: fox cruelty case passed to complex crime unit
text: an investigation into allegations of animal cruelty at the kennels of the south herefordshire hunt has been passed on to the west midlands complex crime unit .
five people arrested on sus of the crime last summer have been rebailed until june .
the west mercia police investigation was sparked by a video , secretly filmed by activists , appearing to show live fox cubs being taken into a shed where hounds were kept to be killed .
author: Nicola Goodwin
Reporter, BBC Hereford & Worcester

documents.title: 'it 's a joke ' : opposition councillor slams senior appointments to committees
text: the largest opposition group on herefordshire council has been left without a single senior appointment on any of the council 's committees .
author: Hereford Times

documents.title: blackpole munitions factory : recognition at last
text: more than 70 years after they worked in the blackpole munitions factory , worcestershire will say an official thank you to the workers today .
a black pear tree will be planted at county hall and a plaque erected to honour the hundreds of men and women who worked in the bullets factory during the two world wars .
kathleen halford was one of a number of women who travelled in to the factory from upton-upon-severn .
it was really quite exciting jo aston from kempsey , he had coaches and he used to come and us up in the morning .
we were a noisy lot , we really were .
it 's a long time ago but i did enjoy it i really did . ''
author: Nicola Goodwin
Reporter, BBC Hereford & Worcester

documents.title: body of missing man found in river severn
text: a body recovered from the river severn in worcester over the weekend is believed to be that of the missing man karl horton .
the 38-year-old was last seen in the city centre around midnight last monday .
formal identification is yet to take place , but writing on facebook karl 's brother gary thanked everyone for their support and said that they would miss him so much .
emergency services were called to the river severn at around 20:45 on saturday and a man 's body was pulled from the water near to the ketch .
west mercia police say his death is not being treated as sus
author: Russell Truran
Journalist, BBC Radio Stoke

documents.title: worcestershire set up chance of victory
text: it 's the final day of worcestershire 's four-day county championship match at derby .
after two rain-hit days , derbyshire added 75 runs to be bowled out for 275 yesterday - visiting skipper joe leach taking 4-50 .
former captain mitchell then made 120 , followed by 150 from brett d'oliveira to help worcestershire close on 323-3 , a lead of 48 .
quick runs today could set up a victory .
listen to the day 's action on bbc hereford & worcester on 738am and online .
author: Dave Bradley
Cricket commentator

documents.title: castlemorton common : the rave that changed the law
text: it 's 25 years today since the start of an illegal festival on castlemorton common that sparked a government clampdown on rave culture .
the criminal justice and public order act was passed two years after the event , giving police the powers to stop and break up large open-air gatherings where loud music was being played .

it began as a travellers festival , but within a few days 20,000 revellers had descended on the common at foot of the malvern hills and with the weather hot and sunny , the party-goers stayed for a whole week .
decades before the development of social media , word of the event was spread by an answer-machine message .

documents.title: one in 10 london midland trains delayed
text: train operator london midland says more than one in 10 of its trains last week were delayed by more than five minutes .
it tweeted this morning to say 84 % of its 6,503 trains were on time or less than five minutes late , with the uk average being 91 % .
the operator said almost a quarter of the delays were down to london midland issues , rather than network faults .
the week before , the company said 94 % of trains were on time or delayed by less than five minutes .
how our 6,503 trains performed last week : 84 % < 5m late ( uk average 91 % ) // cause of delays : 24 % lm-related , 76 % other issues # keepingtrack
how our 6,508 trains performed last week : 94 % < 5m late ( uk average 94 % ) // cause of delays : 39 % lm-related , 61 % other issues # keepingtrack
how about some figures for overcrowding ?
author: Allen Cook
BBC Local Live

documents.title: election panel : your thoughts on tax
text: the bbc is running an election panel , asking voters for their thoughts ahead of 8 june .
we asked :
tax has become a big election issue .
who should be paying more and who less ?
what should our approach to taxation be and whose policies do you support if any ?
mandy , worcester : `` i believe that the highest earners should pay more tax stop taking money from people that are not well off . ''
mark james , stoke on trent : `` companies should pay more tax and off-shore located people if they do business in the uk should pay no matter where their domicile is .
`` the working people should pay less as they have always bore the brunt of taxation , more disposable income more money spent on ''luxuries ''
beatrice benson , shrewsbury : `` i do n't think it 's fair for people who earn more to pay a larger percentage .
the current tax policies still mean that more money is paid from wealthier individuals .
`` labour 's policies would mean paying an extraordinary amount of tax , which the party do n't seem to have specified , which is a coincidence . ''

documents.title: midnight deadline to register to vote
text: today 's your last chance to register to vote in the general election on 8 june .
so far , more than two million people have applied since a snap election was called .
however , the electoral commission has warned that approximately seven million people across britain who are eligible to vote are not registered .
the deadline to register through the official website is 23.59 .

text: a dry day with some good sunny spells and it will feel warm , with top temperatures of 23c ( 73f ) .
author: Alex Hamilton

text: welcome to herefordshire and worcestershire live on monday morning .
we 'll be bringing you all the news , sport , travel and weather as it happens .
